title: ICE `assertion failed: import.imported_module.get().is_none()` `--edition=2021`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code `rustc --edition=2021 file.rs` ```Rust #[std( = )] extern crate blah as std; use std::arch; ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` binary: rustc commit-hash: 22f247c6f3ed388cb702d01c2ff27da658a8b353 commit-date: 2023-03-13 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output ``` error[E0463]: can't find crate for `blah` --> treereduce.out:2:1 | 2 | extern crate blah as std; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ can't find crate error: macro-expanded `extern crate` items cannot shadow names passed with `--extern` --> treereduce.out:2:1 | 2 | extern crate blah as std; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ ```
Backtrace

33: 0x0 - error: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.70.0-nightly (22f247c6f 2023-03-13) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: #0 [resolver_for_lowering] getting the resolver for lowering end of query stack error: aborting due to 2 previous errors For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`. ```
